Employment Type: full-time

Description:
Job Title: Private Equity Operating Partner
East 57th Street Partners is actively seeking a seasoned Private Equity Operating Partner on behalf of one of our esteemed private equity clients. This pivotal role is designed for a highly experienced executive with a proven track record in driving value creation, operational improvements, and strategic growth within portfolio companies. The Operating Partner will work closely with the private equity team and the leadership of portfolio companies to implement best practices, achieve operational excellence, and execute growth strategies.
Role Summary:The Private Equity Operating Partner will be instrumental in identifying and executing on opportunities for operational improvement and strategic growth across the portfolio. This role requires a blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and the ability to work effectively with management teams at portfolio companies. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of industry trends, competitive dynamics, and value creation levers that can drive significant returns on investment.
Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with investment teams to conduct due diligence on potential investments, focusing on operational capabilities, growth opportunities, and potential synergies.Develop and implement strategic plans for portfolio companies, including operational improvements, market expansion, and organizational development.Serve as a key advisor to CEOs and management teams of portfolio companies, providing expertise and guidance on business transformation and best practices.Drive performance improvement initiatives across portfolio companies, leveraging data analytics, process reengineering, and technology enhancements.Monitor and evaluate the performance of portfolio companies against operational and financial metrics, identifying areas for improvement.Facilitate knowledge sharing and best practices across the portfolio, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.Support portfolio companies in M&A activities, including due diligence, integration planning, and post-merger integration execution.Contribute to the overall strategy of the private equity firm, including sector focus, investment thesis development, and portfolio construction.Qualifications:Extensive experience in senior executive roles, preferably with a strong background in operational leadership, consulting, or private equity.Proven track record of driving operational improvements, strategic growth, and value creation within complex organizations.Deep understanding of financial analysis, business strategy, and market dynamics.Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with CEOs and management teams.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.Flexibility to travel extensively and work across various industries and geographic locations.Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related field; MBA or relevant graduate degree strongly preferred.Benefits:Competitive compensation package, including base salary, performance bonuses, and potential participation in investment profits.Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of professionals in a leading private equity firm.Exposure to a broad range of industries and companies, providing a rich environment for professional growth and development.Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans.Retirement savings plan with company contribution.Generous vacation and personal leave policies.

Experience Level (if available): Executive

Job Title: Private Equity Operating Partner
East 57th Street Partners is actively seeking a seasoned Private Equity Operating Partner on behalf of one of our esteemed private equity clients.

Collaborate with investment teams to conduct due diligence on potential investments, focusing on operational capabilities, growth opportunities, and potential synergies.
Develop and implement strategic plans for portfolio companies, including operational improvements, market expansion, and organizational development.
Serve as a key advisor to CEOs and management teams of portfolio companies, providing expertise and guidance on business transformation and best practices.
Drive performance improvement initiatives across portfolio companies, leveraging data analytics, process reengineering, and technology enhancements.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of portfolio companies against operational and financial metrics, identifying areas for improvement.
Facilitate knowledge sharing and best practices across the portfolio, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.
Support portfolio companies in M&A activities, including due diligence, integration planning, and post-merger integration execution.
Contribute to the overall strategy of the private equity firm, including sector focus, investment thesis development, and portfolio construction.
